title: Senior Product Manager
content:
About MasterControl:
MasterControl Inc. is a leading provider of cloud-based quality and compliance software for life sciences and other regulated industries. Our mission is the same as that of our customers to bring life-changing products to more people sooner. The MasterControl Platform helps organizations digitize, automate and connect quality and compliance processes across the regulated product development life cycle. Over 1,000 companies worldwide rely on MasterControl solutions to achieve new levels of operational excellence across product development, clinical trials, regulatory affairs, quality management, supply chain, manufacturing and postmarket surveillance. For more information, visit www.mastercontrol.com.
Senior Product Manager
The Senior Product Manager plays a critical role in defining the future of MasterControl business intelligence products for the Medical Device, Pharmaceutical, Biotech and Life Sciences industries. This Product Manager will be required to conduct research with customers and stakeholders to understand the challenges our customers face, and how we can help them to address those challenges with meaningful analytics and insights.  This Product Manager will define the roadmap for our business intelligence and export products, working collaboratively with other data and application product managers to collect specific requirements from multiple domains, and then prioritizing the initiatives that will create the most value for our customers.  The ideal candidate is someone with a passion for business intelligence and data, a strong ability to partner with engineers and analysts, and a deep understanding of how we can use data to solve significant problems for our customers. The ideal candidate will also have a strong understanding of predictive analytics and would work with our ML Product Manager to prioritize related initiatives when appropriate.  
 
RESPONSIBILITIES 

Defines and executes on the roadmap for data export and data visualization solutions  
Works collaboratively with other product managers to identify how data visualization and business intelligence can enrich the value of MasterControl products and solutions  
Regularly interacts with customers to understand their problems and needs, to obtain feedback, and define best-in-class solutions that fit our needs   
Ensures we are delivering high quality data solutions to our customers by conducting user acceptance testing of dashboards and data prior to release  
Partners with business intelligence analysts on the best visualizations for a particular use case 
Closely partners with Engineering, Architecture, Product Designers, Technical Program Managers and other stakeholders, driving concepts from ideation through to launch and beyond  
Serves as a data quality thought leader at MasterControl  
Displays strong leadership, organization, and execution skills  
Works to understand MasterControl’s strategic and competitive position and deliver products that are aligned with our mission  
Communicates and collaborates across cross-functional teams – product marketing, sales, support, services, etc., to ensure successful product launch and adoption 

 
SKILLS 

A team player who has empathy for others and the ability to develop positive, strong, collaborative relationships with internal and external stakeholders, particularly within Engineering and Product  
Strong ability to write clear and concise requirements 
More than 5 years of experience with data visualizations, business intelligence solutions and data pipelines highly preferred 
Strong customer facing communication skills 
Proficiency in data analysis and interpretation to make data-driven decisions 
Proven experience delivering products and solution to customers 
Ability to understand technical needs and limitations of visualization tools, data warehousing, data security, and their interplay with machine learning and AI product initiatives  
Experience working to understand customer needs from qualitative and quantitative analysis  
Ability to develop innovative, market-leading solutions that solve customer problems and add value  
Strong prioritization skills and ability to understand impact of roadmap on customers and business  
Data driven to identify trends and measure the impact on the product or features you build  
Excellent verbal and written communication skills  
Self-managed and dedicated approach with the ability to work independently  
Strong problem-solving capabilities as well as the flexibility to deal with changing or conflicting priorities  
Bachelor's degree in Business, Computer Science, Science, Engineering or equivalent work experience. 
Experience as a Product Manager working directly on GxP compliant solutions with a Medical Device, Pharmaceutical, Biotech, or other Life Sciences manufacturing company or related software development is preferred but not required 

PHYSICAL DEMANDS AND WORKING CONDITIONS 

Ability to communicate effectively in writing, in person, over the phone or online meetings and in e-mail  
Ability to operate a computer and work at a desk for extended periods of time  
Some occasional travel is required, typically to interact with customers, present at user group meetings, etc.  

 
 
Why Work Here?
#WhyWorkAnywhereElse?
MasterControl is a place where Exceptional Teams come together to do their best work. In fact, hiring Exceptional Teams is a core value of ours. MasterControl employees are surrounded by intelligent, motivated, and collaborative individuals. We like to call it #TheBestTeamOnThePlanet.
We work hard to develop and challenge our employees' skillsets, recognize their contributions, encourage professional development, and offer a one-of-a-kind culture. This is why we say #WhyWorkAnywhereElse?
MasterControl could be your next (and last) career move!
Here are some of the benefits MasterControl employees enjoy:

Competitive compensation
100% medical premium coverage (yes, you read that right!)
401(k) plan with company match
Generous PTO packages that increase with tenure
Schedule flexibility
Fitness clubs (you get paid to have fun and be active!)
Company parties and employee recognition programs
Wellness programs (free Fitbit, gym membership and athletic shoe reimbursements, etc.)
Onsite physician and massage therapist
Innovation center and gaming rooms at the office
Dental/vision plans
Employer paid life insurance policy
Much, much more!

Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis.
The US base salary range for this full-time position is $140,000- $170,000 + equity + benefits. Our salary ranges are determined by role, level, and location. The range displayed on each job posting reflects the minimum and maximum target for new hire salaries for the position across all US locations. Within the range, individual pay is determined by work location and additional factors, including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training. Your recruiter can share more about the specific salary range for your preferred location during the hiring process.
MasterControl is an Equal Opportunity Employer. If you are an individual with a disability and require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the application process, or are limited in the ability or unable to access or use this online application process and need an alternative method for applying, you may contact MCTalent@MasterControl.com or call (801) 942-4000 and ask to speak with a member of Human Resources.

offices.location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
